subject: Fwd: VAM motors getting stuck on.
description_text:
Hi,

Please see forwarded. message... I don't know if I sent this to the wrong
email address but I sent it on the 26th of December and I have not received
any type of response regarding this issue. I've also had this happening
since with I sent that email, with only ABS and Rumble strips effects on.

I'm hoping to get these issues resolved soon because I want to post a
review on my blog about the Simsonn pedals and pedal haptic motors that I
recently purchased.

Thank you,
Frank

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Frank Piccolo <gallery616simracing@gmail.com>
Date: Fri., Dec. 26, 2025, 12:40 p.m.
Subject: VAM motors getting stuck on.
To: <service@simsonn.com>


Hi,

I recently purchased Simsonn pedals and haptic motors and whenever I choose
to use Wheel Slip or Wheel lock effects, the motors get stuck on and won't
stop vibrating until I completely turn off the the power, disconnect the
control box from USB and restart.

I've been testing using only ABS, Gear shift and Road rumble and it seems
to be okay with those, but I'd like to be able to use the other effects I
previously mentioned.

My hardware is the new Simsonn Pro Ultra with a pair of the newest VAM Pro
motors. I'm running on Windows 10 Pro and my main Sim is iRacing where I've
been testing the haptics on the pedals using Simhub v9.10.15

I tried using the effects through Simsonn Manager but the ABS kicks in as
soon as I touch the pedal which is obviously not accurate and I believe it
also ends up doing the same thing, as in getting stuck on.

My Pedals / Control box firmware shows CPU 1: v2.0.5, CPU 2: V2.0.4 and
Simsonn Manager v2.1.2
The firmware update page shows "Already the Latest Version!"

Please advise.

Thank you,
Frank

conversations.body_text: Hi Frank Piccolo,  If this occurs, it indicates that your PC’s grounding may be unreliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used in a grounded wall outlet. You can refer to the post below and connect the three metal screws on the PC case, control box, and pedals, which should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

My race rig is completely grounded I get continuity from the chassis,
through to the pedals, the rods on the pedals and to my wheelbase and parts
of my steering wheel to confirm all have continuity to the ground and my
computer has always had a 3 prong ground plug, it's standard here in Canada.
The only thing that is getting disconnected would be the motors, not the
pedals. Occasionally if I launch the Simpson manager I get a message to
update the firmware and if I try and run the updater it says completed but
the progress bar doesn't move, it stays at 0%. See attached screenshot.
The other thing I had mentioned in my previous email is the motor(s)
getting stuck on, as in a constant vibration that gets triggered from
within iRacing and won't stop until I reset the pedals by unplugging the
USB.

Frank


On Thu., Jan. 1, 2026, 10:34 p.m. support@simsonn.com,

Hi Frank Piccolo,     ​Please uninstall SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.2 from your computer first, then download and install SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.3 from our official website.  SIMSONN Manager 2.1.3 includes optimizations for the vibration function. Please test again using this version.  https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download
